oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Haselrig dairy milk deliveryman
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Claiming Space
Work
African Americans
Milkmen & milkwomen; Trucks
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A milk deliveryman and his car from the Haselrig Dairy. Haselrig Dairy was owned by an African American named C.D. Haselrig.

C.D. Haselrig opened Haselrig Dairy in the late 1920s, and he sold cheese and produce. In 1949, the dairy started processsing and delivering milk. It may have been the only African American owned dairy of its type in the South during this time period.
